state_summary: Eventual, a company founded by Sammy Sidhu and Jay Chia, has built an open-source data processing engine called Daft to help companies process unstructured data. The company raised $7.5 million in seed funding and $20 million in Series A funding to expand its offering and create a commercial product.
evidence: Eventual's founders witnessed a brewing data infrastructure problem while working at Lyft's autonomous vehicle program
Self-driving cars produce a ton of unstructured data from 3D scans, photos, text, and audio
The company's open-source engine, Daft, is designed to work quickly across different modalities from text to audio and video
Eventual counts Amazon, CloudKitchens, and Together AI as customers
The multimodal AI industry is predicted to grow at a 35% compound annual growth rate between 2023 and 2028
